revised_title: Investigating the Spectra of Wolf and Rayet Stars
tldr: The authors conducted a series of experiments to study the spectra of Wolf and Rayet stars, specifically focusing on the blue bands in their spectra. They compared the spectra of these stars with the blue band of a hydrocarbon flame and found that the bands in the stars did not match the carbon band in the flame. This discovery challenged previous assumptions about the presence of carbon in these stars and led to further investigation into their composition.
